15924659.review:
Took a while to get to the land of tea and scones, screw you publishers, nevertheless, BBCSE was my first BlazBlue game obtained on the X360 and it has been a fast favorite of mine. It boasts no carbon copy clones, a unique range of characters, the kind of deep combat you'd expect from a 2D fighter and some of the best voice acting yet. Hazama's three voice actors (Erik Davies, Spike Spencer, Doug Erholtz, it's complicated yo) seem to delight and enjoy their role with the utmost of glee. To count: we have a heterocromic vampire protagonist with pretty much the weakest key to the world, an ice knight obsessed with said protagonist, a catgirl with swords in her hands, a valkryie-esque knight, a dude in a suit with a butterfly knife, a red devil, a werewolf butler, a gothic lolita vampire (she's umpteen dozen years of legal yo), a knight in armor with a big-ass katana, three asstasstic female weapons, Travis WillingHAM, a shota with his robotic sister, a squirrel girl (DAT TAIL DAT TAIL DAT TAIL), a magical girl, and a shapeless blob of buggy onslaughts.

Perhaps the only sore point is the graphics, which don't do so good at 1080p. The sprite art and backgrounds are crisp... if you play at the game's native 768p. Playing at any higher introduces scaling artifacts which detract from the stellar design. For this reason I suggest running it in windows or unscaled fullscreen. 

It also boasts over its younger brother (Nii-san!) the unmatched advantage of online play, and all the new CSE songs downloaded as extra content. The only sore point seems to be the price, pretty damn premium, but then again I did splash on the collector's edition on X360 so who am I to judge? 

10/10 Would 3C -> 214D-C -> 5C-> j.Cx5 -> j.214B again.

15906127.review:
The following is my [b]PERSONAL[/b] opinion! (Originally posted on 05/05/15)

[u]Pros:[/u]

- The game looks gorgeous from it's jawdropping animation to the meticulously crafted backgrounds.

- A healthy cast of 19 characters to choose from. Each with unique, distinguished visual style and fighting mechanics. Everyone is fully voiced in both Japanese and English so you can choose in what language you prefer to hear them.

- Surprisingly good and deep story for a fighting game, presented in a visual novel style. As an added bonus you don’t have to buy the previous installment, Calamity Trigger, because the entire story mode is included here too!

[u]Cons:[/u]

- Some characters feel cheaper in comparison to others. While e.g. Tsubaki, Makoto or Hazama rely on skilled gameplay, understanding and positioning to succeed, other character like Tager or Ragna can steamroll you with two or three moves clumsily strung together. 

- The story ends on a cliffhanger only to be continued in Chrono Phantasma, which (as of 05/05/15 still) is a PS3/4/Vita exclusive. If you are interested in the game’s lore, you will have to wait for a future port, buy a console or read up elsewhere to know what’s gonna happen next.

- While the single player content is abundant, it feels like pointless padding. Unlimitedmars is a carbon copy of Score Attack on highest difficulty. The Abyss mode is another score attack, presented as a tedious gauntlet of matches where you fight increasingly difficult AI. Why Challenge mode was separated from the Tutorial section is anyone’s guess, you’ll only be learning character specific combos there.

-[b]The controls in this game are terrible![/b] You need to have an arcade stick or a very twitchy controller to perform some of the ridiculous character inputs. If you, like me, play the game casually on a keyboard, you are screwed because nearly every special move will be difficult to perform. This is also something that Calamity Trigger suffered from, I am sad to see these issues not resolved in the sequel. 

- [b][u]The multiplayer is abandoned.[/u][/b] I had the game for nearly a week and tried to combat some people online during various hours of the day. There were never more than 5 lobbies available which I could never enter due to some [b]dubious connection issues[/b]. Nobody joined my lobby while I had it open for more than an hour at a time. The same applies to Ranked mode, I had the queue running for hours and only gotten one match from someone and afterwards we could never connect again after trying a bunch of times.

[u]The verdict:[/u] I unfortunately can’t recommend this game. While the presentation is superb, the core of the game, i.e. fighting other players online, is missing. If you enjoy sitting in an empty online lobby by yourself or are satisfied with fighting the computer AI, the game could be worth your time, maybe.

Aussi soudain que cela puisse paraître Blazblue: continuum shift extend est de sortie sur nos PC, Enfin (après 2 ans quand même)!!

L'adaptation est excellente, je n'ai remarqué aucun problème de ce côté-là, il tourne bien même sur un PC modeste

Le jeu reste un excellent jeu de combat nerveux et très exigeant, si vous désirez atteindre l'élite des joueur, préparez-vous à de nombreuses heures d'entrainement, le roster de personnage est variée, chacun se jouant différemment.

Le mode histoire (en anglais uniquement), s'avère suffisamment et intéressant pour nous maintenir en haleine un petit moment ainsi que les différents modes de jeux disponible: Unlimited Mars, Abyss, Arcade, en ligne et versus

Un petit point maintenant sur le jeu en ligne, il est désormais géré par steam (adieu GFWL) pour notre plus grand bien, 
Je ne vous cache pas que si vous possédez une connexion qui laisse à désirer et que vous jouez contre des personne d'un autre continent, vous subirez un lag plus ou moins insupportable durant vos matchs.

Je vous recommande l'achat si n'avez jamais pu y jouer sur console et attendiez de pied ferme un Blazblue sur PC, les néophytes  devront tout de même s'habituer car Blazblue n'est le plus accessible des jeux de combats. 
 
toutefois je conseillerai aux plus patients d'attendre l'éventuelle annonce de Blazblue: Chrono Phantasma Extend sur PC, car on ne sait jamais!

15027465.review:
This game has 2 sides to it, it has a -very- robust Story mode for those who are not willing to compete or do not really enjoy the fighting game aspect of it, which i will not be getting into, and on the other it is one of the most complex fighting games i have ever played.

I do not intend to go in full details but i feel i must explain why i claim it's one of the most complex fighting games i have ever played. Note that i do not mean complexity as something necessarily good or even bad, it is what it is.

Blazblue has a lot of bars and mechanics that by itself already makes a person familiar with the genre feel a little disoriented. Each player has acess to a heat gauge(super meter), guard primers(when a player runs out of it, he/she gets crumpled), barrier gauge(it allows you to defend more attacks on the air, and to completely deny chip damage), up to 2 bursts(when used breaks the opponent's offence by sending him flying horizontally, or if he is not currently attacking you, a gold burst will go out instead sending him flying vertically allowing you to follow up with combos) and a character-specific gauge. The heat gauge can be used to perform "rapid cancels" which recovers your attack instantly allowing you to perform otherwise impossible combos, the usual supers and and "astral heats" to instantly kill your opponent in anime style under very specific circumstances.

Now that the bars are off the way, the game has a great deal of complexity in it's inner mechanics, i'm unfortunately not the guy that will be able to shed all the light on this subject since i am not very familiar with it myself, but i will at least try to acknowledge its existence to anyone that happens to read this.

First of all, links in this game are not really a problem, i could easily feel this when trying to do combos and the links would just come up very naturally, without having to put hard effort into them like Street Fighter 4 needs. That's because in this game if you hold the button you have 5 frames that the input will still be active instead of 1, and i never had to actually hold the button, my finger by itself probably stayed for 5 frames just by pressing on it. Now, i know that this might be seen as something that makes this game "casual" by those who have mastered games like SF, but that couldn't be farther from the truth, the game it's still very challenging and very deep, i might even say that is absurdly so. This mechanic to me feels like it was developed to make the player focus on actually playing and learning the game instead of memorizing and mastering strict timings.

Combo scaling in this game is not as simple as putting a percentage to the the number of hits that have ocurred. I still do fully not grasp it, but something to be aware of is that by doing the same attack twice in a combo will cause it to drop not only it's own damage considerably but also all the following attacks'. Another thing to be aware of is that the hitstun is based on how much time has passed since the start of the sequence and which attack was used to start it.

In Blazblue, after being released of your adversary's combo you are not forced to stand, if you want you can just stay on the air/ground which allows him to continue attacking you, but making vortexes and setups something easier to be dealt with. If you do want to wake up you have a lot of methods. You can do it on the air, by hitting the ground to perform an emergency roll which is pretty safe, rolling horizontally while on the ground so you can distance yourself/move to your enemy's backside(which is also an alternative to get out of the corner), or by just getting on your feet like you would in real life. One must be careful because some of those alternatives are vulnerable and can get you in even more trouble if not used properly.

As a minor note, backdashing in this game has invunerability as it is to be expected, the majority of the cast having 5 or 7 frames, with Tager having 19 invun frames in a 23 frame duration since he is a grappler.

Mental note: If i want to recommend another game, just write something cheesy and call it a day.

The game has a very deep and compelling story which is unheard of in most fighting games. The game features hand drawn 2d sprites for every character that are absolutely beautiful. The amount of depth in this game's fighting system  is so vast that you can pull off some of the most intense matches you will ever have in a fighter. This is one of my all time favorite video games and I highly recommend  it to anyone remotely interested in fighters.

14897276.review:
ถึงแม้ถ้ามองแบบผ่าน ๆ จาก Screenshot แล้ว "BlazBlue: Continuum Shift Extend" อาจจะแลดูไม่ต่างไปจาก "BlazBlue: Calamity Trigger" อันเป็นภาคก่อนหน้าสักเท่าใดนัก ทว่าในความเป็นจริงแล้ว "Continuum Shift Extend" นับได้ว่าเปลี่ยนไปมากจากภาคก่อนหน้า และ ณ ปัจจุบัน "BlazBlue: Continuum Shift Extend" (ต่อไปผมจะเรียกย่อ ๆ ว่า CSE เพื่อประหยัดเนื้อที่) ก็คือเกม Fighting ที่ทำให้ผมรู้สึกหฤหรรษ์มากที่สุดเท่าที่จะหาได้บนหน้าร้านค้าของ Steam

ความเปลี่ยนแปลงที่สำคัญที่สุดของ CSE นั้นก็คือระบบควบคุมของเกมจะมีอยู่ 2 ระบบก็คือ "Technical" และ "Stylish" โดย "Technical" นั้นก็คือระบบที่คุณจะได้ควบคุมโยกคันโยกซ้ายขวาหน้าหลังและกดปุ่มพร้อมกันในแบบฉบับเกม Fighting ที่ดี ในขณะที่ "Stylish" นั้นจะเป็นอะไรที่ต่างออกไป เพราะในโหมด "Stylish" คุณจะสามารถปล่อยท่าต่าง ๆ ได้โดยการกดปุ่มเพียงปุ่มเดียวพร้อมกับกดทิศทางเท่านั้น...

เฮ้! แบบนั้นมันก็ไม่ใช่เกม Fighting แล้วสิ!

จะกล่าวแบบนั้นก็ไม่ผิด แต่ก็ไม่เชิงว่าถูก เพราะ BlazBlue: CSE ยังคงเป็นเกมแนว Fighting เพียงแต่มันเป็นเกมแนว Fighting ที่เป็นมิตรกับผู้เล่น Casual และให้อารมณ์เหมือนเกมแนว Hack & Slash เสียมากกว่า ดังนั้นถ้าคุณหวังว่าจะได้เจอกับเกม Fightning สุดฮาร์ดคอร์ที่เหมาะสำหรับฟาดฟันกันในลานประลองแบบ VS หรือ Online เกมนี้ก็ไม่ใช่เกมที่เหมาะเท่าใดนักสำหรับคุณ (ยกเว้นแต่จะนัดกันมาบวกแบบ Technical โดยเฉพาะ) แต่ถ้าคุณต้องการเกม Fighting ที่เน้นเตะต่อยปล่อยพลังแบบเอามันส์ไม่คิดมาก นี่ก็คือเกมที่เหมาะมากเลยสำหรับคุณ

ในส่วนของเนื้อหา CSE จะดำเนินต่อจากภาคแรกหรือก็คือ Calamity Trigger และก็เหมือนเช่น CT ตัวเกมจะเล่าเรื่องในส่วนของ Story Mode เป็นแบบ Visual Novel ผ่านมุมมองของตัวละครทุกคนผู้มีส่วนร่วมในเหตุการณ์ที่เกิดขึ้น และมีตัวเลือกตัดสินใจที่สามารถส่งให้คุณได้พบกับฉากจบที่หลากหลาย (กระนั้น True End Route ก็ยังคงมีเพียงหนึ่ง) ซึ่งถ้าคุณต้องการที่จะเข้าถึงรายละเอียดเชิงลึกและเนื้อหาทั้งหมดรวมถึงความสัมพันธ์ของตัวละคร คุณอาจจะต้องใช้เวลาเล่นรวมหลายสิบชั่วโมงทีเดียว และแน่นอนว่าผมแนะนำว่าคุณควรสัมผัสกับ CT มาก่อน มิฉะนั้นแล้วคุณอาจจะมึนงงสับสนกับเนื้อหาได้ ถึงแม้ในเกมจะมี CT ฉบับย่อให้ได้เล่นกันก็ตาม

โดยรวมแล้ว BlazBlue: CSE นับได้เป็นอีกหนึ่งเกม Fighting ที่ผมแนะนำให้ลองเป็นอย่างยิ่งสำหรับทุกคนครับ

คะแนน 9 / 10

ข้อดี:
+ ตัวละครแต่ละคนที่มีเอกลักษณ์เฉพาะตัวสูงมาก
+/- ระบบ "Stylish" ที่ช่วยให้ผู้เล่นใหม่ลืมตาอ้าปากได้ แต่ก็อาจทำให้ชาว Fighting พันธุ์ฮาร์ดคอร์หงุดหงิดใจได้เป็นอย่างมากเช่นกัน
+ Story Mode ที่สามารถสูบชีพคุณได้นานหลายสิบชั่วโมง
+ Mode ใหม่ผลาญวิญญาณอีกมากมายที่มีให้คุณได้เลือกเล่น
+ ตัวเกมสนับสนุน Steamwork เต็มรูปแบบ

ข้อเสีย:
- ใน Cut-scene หลาย ๆ ครั้ง Subtitles ไม่ตรงกับเสียงและภาพ
- English Voice ไม่เข้าถึงอารมณ์เท่า Japanese Voice (อันนี้ คหสต. เพราะตัวผมเองชอบ Rachael ที่ให้เสียงโดย Kana Ueda มากกว่าเสียงแบบ English ที่ฟังดูแล้วไม่เข้ากับลักษณะนิสัยของเธอสักเท่าไหร่)

14853196.review:
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=407102487
Купил эту игру ради сисястой белки. Не пожалел. 10/10.

У этой игры много плюсов: очень афигенная игровая механика - каждый персонаж дерется с помощью своего собственного стиля, который действительно работает как свой собственный и ни на что не похожий. Например есть белка, которая дерется странными фалоподобными тонфами. Так вот, её комбо заточенны на удерживании одной из кнопок (D) для сильного/слабого размаха удара. Так же, если нажимать по очереди каждую из кнопок в определенной последовательности - она выдает очень классное комбо. И такая ситуация у КАЖДОГО персонажа - кто-то меняет дополнительное оружие на "D", кто -то наоборот полностью меняет стиль боя оставляя на эту кнопку свое оружие, а у кого-то шкала "маны" сама заполняется - но спец.комбо у него зависит от того в какой момент всё накопленно. Больше всего понравились Дзин и Ноэль. Дзин это такой чувак с катаной, оружие которого умеет кастовать лед в разных пропорциях, а Ноэль является марианеткой своих двух стволов, с помощью которых она выделывает афигенную цепочку ударов (вообще в blazblue большинство персонажей одержимы своим собственным оружием).
Каждый из персонажей выглядит просто потрясно, но полностью расскрывается именно в бою. В отличии от стрит файтера, где всё решает тайминг и скорость выполнения какого-нибудь хадокена - здесь всё решает против кого вы сражаетесь и как хорошо владеете своим персонажем. Да, в стрит файтере все персонажи тоже разные и дерутся по разному - но их различия заключаются лишь в разновидности хадокена, шаокена и то по какой диагонали нужно клацать чтоб его выполнить.
Также к плюсам относиться офигенная сюжетная компания, выполненная в стиле визуальной новеллы. Сюжетная линия продолжает первую часть, а для тех кто с ней не ознакомился - здесь есть качественный пересказ первой части с возможностью "press x to win" для самых маленьких.
Графика очень радует глаз. Каждый персонаж тщательно прорисован, классно анимирован и щедро озвучен. Задние фоны, выполненные в 3D так же восхищают. А уж какая тут музыка! Alexandrite, Gluttony Fang и Rebellion (особенно последние две и их вокальные варианты) - надежно переслушиваются в ВК изо дня в день.
К минусам, наверное отнесу штампованность - главный злодей психопат-феласаф желающий видеть мир в огне (у него кстати тоже бледная кожа и зеленые волосы, да и ножами дерется), лоли-трап с диссоциальным расстройством личности, комик-релиеф ХОКАГЕ с огромным гвоздём за спиной, Ноэль с плоскими сиськами и шутками про это, и т.д. и т.д.

Если конечно закрыть глаза на это, то всё будет просто идеально.

14739738.review:
First things first, I'd like to say, I've never been one to enjoy a 2D fighter game for more than a few minutes. Now, that being said, this one is easily the best I've ever played. I picked it up on release, not expecting to play much of it, but after trying it out, I couldn't stop playing.
 Particularly, I found the story mode to be of the most interest, and boy, is it a good story, though, for me, It was a bit confusing, and hard to grasp until I learned more about the series.

The fighting handles pretty well, especially if you have a controller. The animation of the character sprites is wonderful in battle too, and the moves are all great to look at.

With a large roster of characters, you should have a fun time trying everyone out, and deciding which you like best. And every character has his or her own amazing theme music.
accompanying the large character roster is a wonderful english voice cast, that I personally think fit each character perfectly.

As far as incentive to keep playing, there's the alternate endings in each characters story mode, And the gallery. There are hours upon hours of unlockables to be found in the gallery. Gallery unlockables consist of mostly wonderfully illustrated CG's, and some animated cinematics, which can be seen in story mode. 

The only bad things I can really come up with, come with online play. I'm not sure if it even has an active online community, so finding a match against another player might not happpen. I could be wrong though.

Though, there is one other downside I can think of. Some characters come off as terribly OP. Lambda 13 and Hakumen come to mind. (That or I totally suck against those two)

So, a summary of the pros and cons

Pros
-Great voice cast
-A good, but slightly confusing story
-Large roster of fighters to toy around with
-Hours of unlockable CG's
-A great sound track

Cons
-Some OP fighters
-Not enough online players
-The story is pretty confusing, and hard to grasp, even if you've played Calamity Trigger

My personal rating is 10/10
Um...The official rating...8.9/10? (I'm never good at official ratings.)

I say if you're into 2Dfighters, deffinately pick this one up.

1 of my favorite games of all time, to be honest.

Aside from balance issues, the gameplay is solid. All characters have different playstyles, some are easier to learn than the others, some are harder, but still. What the heck did you expect from the guys behind Guilty Gear?

Speaking of balance issues, a few characters got hit hard by the nerf bat. Rachel's got the worst of it, being low-tier. Tsubaki even got nerfed from her decent status in CS:II to CS:E. Some got buffed, but from my experience (I'll admit, I suck) it just kinda upset the balance a little.

The music is absolutely awesome. The graphics are eye-pleasing to look at. The story is a bit... ehh... on the meh scale, I guess? It's kinda confusing and corny.

The netcode's a bit awful, though. While disconnection doesn't happen that often, it lags a lot and if you happen to play a character that uses long combos like Makoto, I pray for your soul in netplay.

Overall, I'd definitely recommend this game. It's fun.

... now, back into the BlazBlue hell I belong, awaiting CP.

14178105.review:
Amazing game! I definitely recommend it for anyone who cares at least a little bit about fighting games - even for
casual brawls with friends, since all characters are so well defined and the pace of matches is really enjoyable.

I would give it a 8/10 for these reasons:

Pros:
	- Solid net code for online play
	- Slick interface that's easy to navigate through
	- A visual novel level Story mode with many choices and outcomes
	- Well thought and understandable tutorials for both game mechanics and character strategies
	- An extensive Gallery mode that has many music tracks, art pieces, animations, and character alternate colors to unlock
	- Deep and solid fighting mechanics that are very interesting to explore
	- Well rounded Training mode that offers many options to practice virtually any possible scenarios
	- Characters are very unique, both in personality and gameplay
	- Many "One Player" modes to entertain when no rivals available, including Arcade, Story, Score Attack, and Challenge modes
	- Replay Theater mode offers very helpful functions for both entertainment and learning from match videos
	- Very suitable as a first air dasher to begin playing this particular sub genre of fighting games

Cons:
	- Price is a little bit expensive for a nearly three years old game
	- Networks mode is confusing at first and takes some time to get used to
	- Combos are a little too long and in many cases tricky to be consistent
	- No "Rematch" option at the end of a match even in off-line Versus mode (forced to go to character select screen at the end of every match)
	- Story is a little confusing and hard to follow, especially with so many non canon routes

14176360.review:
I wrote a review previously for this game a month ago but complained about one major thing that was missing from the port: the inability to view opponents' connections. You'd have to experiment with different rooms and players to see who has a playable connection with you and who does not. There was also no way to stop laggy people from joining your room either.

However, the recent online patch has fixed this issue. What really makes me happy though is not that it's finally fixed, but rather that the publisher, H2, was actually kind enough to release a patch.

But yeah, to get back to the general review:


GAME OVERVIEW

Blazblue is a renown 2D fighting game known for its stunning visuals and diverse cast of playable characters. Each character plays different from the next; you could be a god with a sturdy, defensive character like Hakumen but struggle with a puppet character like Carl. Each character has their own unique play style so choosing a main or finding the character that clicks right with you isn't very hard at all in Blazblue.


OFFLINE CONTENT

There's tons of this. The tutorial does a decent job of explaining some of the game's basic mechanics and teaches you how to play Blazblue. It's kind of long, but well worth it if you're new to the game and interested in playing against others at a higher level. The game has a "Stylish Mode" for beginners who want to do combos but haven't learned the execution for them yet: it's a mode where you do small combos by just pressing one button so it's something quite nifty to have if you wanna just play this game at a party with friends or something. I do not advise you to use this often if you're trying to learn this game at a more serious level since Stylish Mode limits the players' overall options and makes the player do unsafe strings on block, which will lead to heavy punishes when facing an opponent that knows what blocking is.

Arcade mode is like any other run-of-the-mill fighter where you face off against nine rounds of opponents before fighting a boss character who has enhanced attacks and specials and boasts higher HP. Story mode is quite long. If you're interested in stories typical of anime and don't mind doing some reading, then Story Mode is definitely going to be enjoyable. There's Abyss mode too where you fight waves of opponents but pick up buffs and attribute boosters that increase parameters like damage, defense, and movement speed, giving this offline mode the feel of an action RPG almost.

Challenge Mode is what you'll most likely be doing after finishing the tutorial. It's a mode where the game teaches you a few basic BnBs which are your main staple combo routes. It doesn't exactly tell you how to utilize these combos in an actual match though - that's something you're going to have to learn for yourself through experience and watching higher level players. Regardless, it's still a mode you're going to spend a few hours in if you want to start practicing some basic combos for a character you want to pick up and learn. Especially if you are a beginner to fighting games, you will be spending tens of hours in this mode polishing up your execution in this mode and it's very well worth it.

Training Mode is probably where you'll be spending most of your time offline if you plan on getting online. It's pretty standard as far as most training modes in fighting games go but is absolutely crucial if you want to improve or sharpen your skills. Besides combo practice, you can practice hit confirming by setting the dummy to Random block or you can practice your defense by utilizing the record function to recreate some sticky situations you might have found yourself in before.

The game also has a nice little gallery where you can unlock artwork or stuff like new color palettes in exchange for in-game cash that you can only get by playing the game.


ONLINE MODE

The netcode itself is good. The game is smooth as butter when playing against those who live in the same region. (3-4 bar connection) 1-2 bars are okay but it might be a bit more difficult to block things like standing overheads on reaction but besides that, are very playable. 0 bars are kind of a hit-or-miss. I'm a player from California and although my connections with Japanese players have been 0 bar this whole time, some JP connections honestly feel like 1-3 bars instead of 0. However, most 0 bars are going to be what the red bar suggests: barely playable to unplayable at all.

What's also important to note is that unless you have godly fiber wifi or something, having a wired connection is almost necessary for playing online. The packet loss from playing on wireless can completely screw matches up even when playing against someone who lives right next door to you. 

The online community itself is diverse. There are players from many different regions inhabiting Network Mode so as long as you don't live in some really distance place like Antarctica, you should be able to find some decent connections depending on the time of day. Skill levels are also all over the spectrum so don't worry about hopping online and getting destroyed by everyone.

Network Mode has two types of battles: Ranked and Player Match. 

In Ranked, your W/L ratio is tracked and you also gain these PSR points for your character at the end of every win; lose PSR at the end of every loss. You gain around 7-9 PSR per win and lose 2-4 PSR per loss until around you've played around 100 or so matches. From that point on, you'll only start gaining 1-2 PSR per win and only from fighting players who have a similar PSR rating or high win ratio. What's important to note however that PSR is only a rough estimation of skill; in no way does it actually determine if the player is good or not. While 750 PSR may be considered high and usually indicates that the player is decent, that 750 PSR player might have just gotten that number from farming off the same weaker players in Ranked or frauded their way to maintaining a high win record by disconnecting after every loss. That said, don't pay too much attention to Ranked in this game since you'll usually find much better quality matches in Player Rooms anyways.

In Player Match, you can choose from a list of lobbies that can seat anywhere from 2-6 people. There are many options you can choose from while creating a room like reserving invitation slots for friends or setting the rotations to Loser Stays or Random instead of the traditional Winner Stays. You can allow for Unlimited Characters to be used if you ever want to mess around with boss versions of characters against other people or set the room to display a "Beginners/Experts Only" icon that will (hopefully) attract the kind of players you're looking for. You can also rename your room too for w/e purpose you want. While waiting for opponents, you can also go into Training Mode (same applies to Ranked as well). 

Player Matches are where you can find most people playing. In Player Match, W/L ratios are not recorded and there is no rating system so you're free to play however you want. Create a friend-only lobby or duke it out with some randoms who might very well become good friends, rivals, or even mentors to you. 

Overall, the game's online is good and there aren't any real problems with it anymore.


10/10 game's a near perfect port of the console versions. It might not be the most recent in the series but it's still a solid stand-alone fighter.

14125332.review:
现在的2D格斗游戏算起来大概有三大厂：Capcom、SNKPlaymore和Arc System Works。这三家公司的代表作分别是Street Fighter（街霸）系列、King of Fighters（拳皇）系列和Guilty Gear（罪恶装备）/BlazBlue（苍翼默示录）系列。而在目前流行的的这些大型2D格斗游戏中，最华丽、最酷炫、最符合萌豚口味的大概就是ASW开发的GG系列与BB系列了。

（题外话，开发月姬格斗和夜下降生的フランスパン（渡辺製作所）个人觉得算不上大厂，毕竟一直算是同人社团，至于做更加萌豚向的Arcana Heart系列和AQUAPAZZA的EXAMU……等什么时候上了EVO我再改口吧w）

关于BlazBlue这个系列，我虽然一直是路人水准，但是接触也有三、四年了，勉强也算得上一个老玩家。身为一个以前因为手残从未碰过格斗游戏的萌豚，第一次见到BlazBlue系列是PSP上的BlazBlue Calamity Trigger，顿时为其华丽的画面、简单的连段、帅气的角色、时髦（中二？）的设定和豪华的声优阵容所倾倒，一边被AI虐一边整天小P不离手，我也是因为这部作品喜欢上了今井麻美。

后来出了PSV，看到可以在随身设备上玩到画面如此精美的新作，而且还是中文版（再说句题外话，BB系列一直有官方中文，但是PSP版的BBCSEX只有日文版），我毫不犹豫地购入了PSV，到手的当天直接买了下载版通宵挂机下载了下来，从此又是一段废寝忘食的日子。再后来入了PS3，为了更好的手感又买了一张PS3版的CSEX整日苦练。但是后来因为学业压力渐渐加大，游戏也很少打了，一直到前段时间考研结束，正好遇上新作BlazBlue Chrono Phantasma发售不久，于是又买了PS3和PSV双版本两份下载版，但是现在感觉游戏智力下降越发严重，玩得也不多了……

Steam版只是为了爱和卡片买的，因为PS3手柄接电脑不太方便所以我也基本没玩，只是和电视上玩PS3版与掌机上小屏幕玩PSV版相比，果然近距离在高分辨率屏幕上看到的画面显得粗糙了很多，

4月份BBCP又要出EX版了，不知道什么时候会移植PC呢？虽然我还是习惯在主机上玩格斗，不过多一个平台在电视被占用的时候可以玩一玩还是很好的~

写完再看结果发现整篇评测只有一句话算得上评测，其他的都是牢骚话……总而言之，这部作品推荐给：
1、所有喜欢格斗游戏的玩家（日本街机厅中BB的机台投币率排名常年位于前几位）；
2、所有想了解这个系列的玩家（因为BBCSEX包括了之前全部作品，即BBCT、BBCS、BBCSII的所有剧情和人物，平衡性有了很多调整，立绘也有所变化）；
3、所有阿宅（泽城美雪、斋藤千和、今井麻美、悠木碧、植田佳奈、高桥智秋、近藤佳奈子……声豚盛宴！），即使不擅长格斗游戏，把难度调到最低也可以当作附带格斗小游戏的Galgame来玩的！

还在等待什么呢？赶快移动鼠标，点击“添加至购物车”买买买吧！

14088829.review:
As an introduction, I am a veteran player of Guility Gear and Blazblue series. I've won numerous tournaments in all versions of Blazblue and held the rank #1 spot for several characters on Xbox live. As i write this review I will be as neutral as possible.

Blazbue is a very unique fighting game franchise, many call it the sister of Guility Gear. Blazblue is an air dasher, high speed,  combo heavy fighting game. The game is very visually satisfying and has one hell of a soundtrack. People who have a history in Street figher, SoulCaibur, DOA, Tekken, etc. Tend to somewhat stray away from Blazblue. The game sets itself apart by its core engine mechanics and unforgivable mistakes.

But fray not, the game is very newcomer friendly. Unlike many other fighting games, Blazblue Extend has an ingame voice over tutorial that guides you step by step on EVERY single game mechanic while teaching you combos at the sametime. After you go through the tutorial, you are encouraged to try "challenge mode." But don't get the challenge mode in this game twisted like the one in Street fighter or Street Fighter x Tekken.

90% Challenge mode combos in this game actually teach you Basic "Bread and butter" combos that you will be using during live play. Even high level pros use some of the bread and butter combos you will see in challenge mode. They are very practical and meter efficient. Once you feel comfortable training and getting your challenge mode combos down you can take the fight online.

Online BB extend has a few differences from the console. You CANNOT turn off your ingame mic and you CANNOT see your opponents ping levels before the fight. The only way to estimate the lag is by actually engaging into the battle. With that being said, there are players from all over the world playing online. If you wish to play in player matches simply name your lobby in the general area of where you live. For example, I live in South Carolina so I name my lobby "Southeast USA", that way people can get a better estimate of the ping to be expected.

But for the sake of keeping the wall of text down, Blazblue is a great fighting game franchise for newcomers and experienced fighters. You will enjoy the incredibly unique and flashy combos by all of the characters. The game also has an interesting and yet paradoxal story which you will have fun trying to figure out on your own! Also check out the blazblue anime online if you have a hulu subscription.
If you have an specific questions regarding the game, you can reply to my review or send me a message on steam.

EDIT: Mics can be muted or turned off ingame now.

14035019.review:
Псс, дружище... Ты ведь хочешь больше файтингов в Стиме? Конечно же хочешь. У тебя есть Injustice, у тебя есть Mortal Kombat, у тебя есть Street Fighter, но ты хочешь больше. Я хочу больше. Мы все хотим больше. Теперь угадай что такое BlazBlue: Continuum Shift Extend. Верно; это файтинг. Покупая его ты буквально говоришь разрабам или издателям "Хей, мужики! Тут есть спрос на этот жанр".

Видишь среди скриншотов игры блондинку в синем берете и в синей форме с двумя револьверами? Её зовут Ноэль и её персонаж очень интересный. Но знаешь что действительно важно? Важно что в этой игре все персонажи такие же интересные. Все. Персонажи. Очень. Интересные.

"Но ведь разработчиком наверняка является какая-нибудь известная компания, которая уже просто штампует подобные игры. Я не стану покупать эту игру. Инди рулит. Divekick forever."
Спокуха; твои честно заработанные деньги получат H2 Interactive. Они хорошие ребята. Такие хорошие, что купили у Arc System Works лицуху на выпуск стимовской версии этой игры. Но есть проблема. Это только вторая часть серии BB и чтобы H2 хватило на издательство третей части, ПК аудитории (*пфф* как обычно) нужно продемонстрировать заинтересованность.  

*А теперь о самой игре* 

Вообще когда дело касается игр я люблю те, в которых сюжетная состовляющая преобладает над геймплеем. 
И особенно я люблю когда такой ход использован в файтингах (Пи*дец я странный, да?).
Так вот, BlazBlue является очень богатым на историю файтингом. Что не удивительно, ведь разработчиками являются Arc Systems Works: люди ответственные за лучший 2D файтинг начала 21 века — Guilty Gear X. Сама основная история излагается в виде визуальной новеллы с перерывами на файтинговую состовляющую и диалогов там много. Очень много. 
Решения принятые во время диалогов (визуалка как-никак) будут приводить к нескольким вариантам исхода, типа каноничной концовки или альтернативной концовки. В итоге истории всех персонажей вольются в одну Истинную концовку, которая "поставит жирную точку" и "обрисует чёткие границы" в Сдвиге Континуума. Кроме того она намекнёт на предстоящие события третий части.

Помимо режима истории в данной игре присутствуют также:
- Toturial (Если вы вообще не умеете в файтинги или не разобрались в механике BB)
- Training mode (Тренеровочка)
- Unlimited Mars mode (Умные боты спамящие жёсткие комбо)
- Challenge mode (Учит набивать комбо)
- Abyss mode (500 этажей постепенно умнеющих ботов)
- Online mode (В народе известен как "Бл*ть! С*ка! Наконец-то добавили!" и "С*ка, чё ты такой сильный то?")
Кроме вышеперечисленного также имеются различные ачивки и открываемые арты. 

Ещё причинами купить эту игру ивляются звуковое сопровождение и визуальное оформление. Двухмерные персонажи отлично смотрятся на фоне трёхмерных, чёткопрорисованных локаций. А музыка написанная Дайске Исиватари придаёт бою интенсивности (VS темы особенно хороши).

Разумеется есть и минусы, например это всё ещё не третья часть (смотрю на тебя Chrono Phantasma), а также отсутствие чёткого разделения по уровням, из-за которого вы в поиске рандомного онлайн матча можете встретить противника который выбъет на вас Perfect и завершит Astral-ом.


Итог: Если вы любите файтинги, если вы любите игры с хорошей историей и кучей деталей, и если вы любите JRock, то вам сюда. Всё, покупайте эту игру.

13992478.review:
When comparing the content in this game to that of the previous entry, it's no wonder Calamity Trigger was recently on sale for only a few bucks. There's a lot to do in Continuum Shift, and you'll find the hours slipping away as you get sucked in.

Such as the extensive storylines with full voice acting. There's barely a time when you will be reading text without somebody speaking it. Not to mention the Japanese voice pack. Never before has a fighting game got me so invested in the characters with the story. 

I actually want to learn the details behind Carl's slow decent into madness and the story behind his puppet. I want to learn the story of Hellsing's past and where he got his werewolf powers. I want to know why Taokaka is so familiar with Litchi that she refers to her as "Boobie Lady".  To learn all this, you play their stories. And as you play their stories, you start to get good with the characters. This all translates into hours and hours spent playing the game. That alone makes the game a worthy purchase at full price. 

There are only a few minor problems with the game. There is no option to turn off voice chat when playing online, which leads to hearing feedback from speakers because people don't realize their mic is on. Also, you'll be hearing "counter counter counter counter counter" so much that it seems like a gross oversight by the developers to leave that in the game. As far as I know, it's not exactly vital information and can be done without. Yet, you'll still have to put up with it. 

I've never been very good at fighting games, but I attribute that to never getting invested in them because of a lackluster story or characters that I couldn't grow to like. Blazblue is the first fighting game that I've put the effort into learning how to play, and it's actually showing! Because I love the characters, the story, the voice acting, the music, and all the extra features put into the game. Not to mention, the extensive tutorial that was missing for the previous game has been a life saver. 

Man, I just love this game.

13823208.review:
Hope you have a decent controller, otherwise this game may give you some mad carpal tunnel.

The Blazblue franchise is a delightful 2D fighting game series presenting 2D characters fighting in 3D backgrounds. Although the background textures aren't amazing, a lot of crazy stuff can go on in dem backgrounds. The resolution settings don't present you with a lot of options, which may be disappointing for some of you. The online network mode also has some flaws, as the settings are very basic, not really allowing you to fight other players in specific regions, and no option to turn off chat within matches (which could potentially get very annoying). I should also mention that the player pool for online play isn't really expansive, as few rooms with specific match settings accepting other players show up, and the the whole "player skill matchup" feature is either hit-or-miss. Even if set to "same strength as me" or "stronger than me," chances are you may run into unknowledgable players or god-tier masters, because the player pool is small. Even though this is isn't the latest in the series, it's still enjoyable and comes with a lot of content, being both friendly to both people who know zilch about 2D fighting games and those who are veterans, as they have a tutorial for you fledglings as well as a lot of content and changable difficulty settings for the hardcore audience. The story is extremely complicated, which is something me and my fellow players never really bring up. Even so, the gameplay is more than enough for make up for it, as investing your time in playing allows you to unlock a lot of content that's just waiting for you, with an entire gallery of artwork, alternate announcer voices, alternate character colors (which may or may not make references to other characters), unlimited forms of said characters (cuz everyone likes utterly destroying your foes) and more items for you to buy (with in-game currency, not real-world money) to change up your chances of faring in the game's Abyss mode. The one thing that Blazblue has that most fighting games lack is the fact that you can rebind both keyboard controls and gamepad controls, which is really helpful.

Now if only we could have Chronophantasma on PC...


...PUHLEEZE, Arc System Works??

13802061.review:
結論：現状ではPCで遊べる対戦ツールとして不合格、オンライン周りの修正が必須
(若干の修正が入りましたが、不十分です)

①ゲーム性
いわゆるコンボゲーなので初心者からはじめるには厳しいゲーム。
最低でも対戦するには基本的な動きその他を覚えるしかなく、練習を重ねなければならない
さらにはキャラごとの対策などが必要なので、これらを乗り越えられないと面白くはないゲーム。
私はこのシリーズやウル4、海外のモーコン、インジャスティス
などある程度格闘ゲームに触れていたため、理解は早いですが、それでも覚えることはたくさんあります
そして、それを覚えたとしても、現状では一人用のモードでしか役に立たない可能性あり。

②オンライン対戦周り
家庭用のマッチングサーバーをそのまま利用してると思われます。
マッチング範囲は海外まで含まれますが、海外とは入力ラグが発生するので対戦するのは難しいと思われます。(ping120-150程度なら若干のラグがあるが遊べる模様) 
また、PC上での動作にまったく最適化ができていないところが、散見しています。
以下に例を挙げます

・steam鯖を使用していないため、対戦履歴が分からない。
[strike]・名前以外のアンテナマークや国,pingといった通信状態を示す表示が一切なく、快適な対戦相手なのかが判別できない。 [/strike]
(通信状態を最低の0から4で示すようになりました)
・建てられた部屋に接続できない可能性がある(日本国内も)
・部屋に空きがあるにもかかわらず、入室できない可能性がある
・入室できない場合に10-20秒の時間がかかる場合があるが、それをすぐにキャンセルできない
・入力ラグがあるとわかるのは対戦が始まる直前。
・たとえ日本国内同士でも、入力ラグが発生する可能性がある。
・開始直後にラグがなくても、試合時間が経過していくとラグが発生していく可能性がある。
[strike] ・steamの設定でPtTにしていても強制的にマイクがオンになり、ゲーム中でもオンオフの設定ができないため、対戦相手からの雑音が入る。物理的に抜くしかない。[/strike]
(ゲーム内オブションでオンオフできるようになりました)
[b] ＊取り消し線部分は2015年1月23日に修正が入りました [/b]

入力ラグは方向キーの上をおしてから、画面内のキャラが操作後に移行フレーム後にすぐにジャンプするかで分かります。
(通常の格闘ゲームにはジャンプ判定になるまでの移行フレームという待機時間があります、統一されている場合やキャラごとに設定されている場合があります)
現状ラグが発生すると、水中戦ではなく、リモートデスクトップのような間接的な操作感になります。
基本的に毎秒60FPSでの描写となっており、入力ラグは最低5Fから10F以上の遅延で発生しています。
格闘ゲームでこの遅延は致命的です、コンボの成立する猶予が3F以内など珍しくはありません。
それどころかまともな操作すら不能になります。
よってトレーニングモードなどで操作を覚えてもそれを発揮できる環境ではありません。
いちおう初心者救済の簡易入力モードなどがありますが、それだけ利用していればいいのでしょうか。
現状人が少ないため、被害者は少ないとは思いますが、
BBCSEXの続編で、現在稼働中のBBCPが家庭用と同時期に移植されるという噂を聞きましたが
この状況では、Steam版は対戦ツールとしては期待できません。

いちおうこちらでも、試せる処置は全てやりましたがまったく効果がないため
このゲームのネットコード自体がまったくPC用に最適化されてないという結論に行き着きました

https://steamcommunity.com/app/294810/discussions/0/620700960415585608/
フォーラムでも話題にありましたが、海外でもラグが発生している模様です。

この問題を認識し、修正をお願いいたします

追記
さまざまなジャンルのマルチプレイをしましたが、日本国内でのラグがここまでひどいゲームは初めてです。
いまどき通信相性なんて言葉を忘れてましたが、それだけでは思えないほど、このゲームはほんとにひどいです。
なんせアメリカ西海岸のフレンドとは常時若干のラグこそあるのですが、快適に遊べるんですから。

追記(2015年1月23日)
通信状態がわかる修正が入りましたが、表示される通信状態がよくてもラグでるんですが、日本国内でまともに遊べるようになるのはいつになるのでしょうか。

+Soundtrack

Overall: Pretty happy with this game! If you're a fan of fighting games, this is a good game to have in your steam library!

13490277.review:
최적화가 덜 되었다. 일부 맵에서 프레임이 확 떨어지는 현상이 있습니다.

더불어, 일부 컴퓨터에서는 게임이 제대로 실행되지 않고, 최악의 경우 강제 재부팅이 되는 사례도 있는 편.

창모드에서는 1600X900까지 밖에 지원을 하지 않으며, 전체 화면에서는 1920X1080까지 지원합니다. 전체화면은 풀과 아케이드로 나눠져 있는데, 풀은 그냥 늘여주는 수준.

그레픽 관련 설정은 초당 프레임 수 표시와 빛 번짐, 안티얼리어싱, 화면 해상도 설정과 창모드와 전체화면 설정밖에 없습니다. 맵에 대한 설정은 그 아무것도 없습니다. 그 마저도 전체화면으로 설정하고, 1920X1080까지 늘리면 텍스트가 자글자글한게 눈에 띄일 정도.

이후에 이 문제점에 대해서 패치를 하게 된다면 이 평가를 철회하겠지만, 그럴 확률이 매우 낮아보인다는게 흠일까.

덥석 사기엔 리스크가 좀 있으니 가격이 확 떨어지거나 패치가 되었다는 소식이 들리면 사는 것을 추천합니다.

13490201.review:
Ну пожалуй распределю все по минусам и плюсам, и начну с хорошего:
-Extend версия, включающая в себя BB CS I, BB CS II, DLC, Voice Pack, OST's.
-Превосходная система боя. А для новичков присутствие Stylish mode, облегчающих нажатия комбо.
-Отличный и интересный сюжет. Суть сюжета можно понять даже не играя в предыдущию часть игры, потому что здесь есть краткий remastered сюжета BB CT. А так же сопутствуют красивые арты, отличная озвучка персонажей и великолепное музыкальное сопровождение(Condemnation Wing - мой фаворит).
-Рабочий без проблем мультиплеер.(Отнесу это к плюсам т.к. на пк с мульти у них еще те траблы были, то GFWL, то вообще вырежут).
Из минусов:
-Опечатки текста на английском языке в стори моде. Сам английский язык, не отношу к минусам, хотя утомляешься все равно больше, нежели если читать сразу русский.
-Много уже придроченных ребят в мульти, которые рвут тебя, как надо - немного обидно(по началу).
-Плохое качество видеороликов и при некоторых настройках их фризит, должно быть из-за их wmv формата =_=

Never been a much fighting fan. But this game, this game is like OMG lads 'n lassies! Gameplay mechanic suited for EVERYONE! You can't do a complicated combos based on standart Arc revolver? Choose a stylish stance and you suddenly can. Or take standart technicl stance and play like most of the combo-fightings. Extrodanary story mode with tons of dialogs of every type: Extremely funny, extremely sad, extremely heartwarming, extremely brutal. EXTREME! Tons of content in gallery. mars attack for real hard core fans, score attack, abyss etc etc. Heh, now I know where Netherrealm took their inspiration for MK and Injustice (but those are like meh in comparison). And soundtrack is to die for! 

What even better, if you have some friends owning this game, or you're one of those competative kind, this installmen of Blazblue in steam have multiplayer (somewhat buggy, but comprehandable). Anyway, I heard "Chronophantasm" is somewhat better, but, and this is a big but: If you're not one of the folks who play on consoles, or you prefer keyboard over gamepad, or you want a great fighting game with a lots of content that you can just enjoy whenever. I strongly recomend Blazblue: Continuum Shift Extended. We'll see if Chronophantasm will make it into Steam, but right now this one is the best you can get... 13467268.review:
I've been clamouring for Arc System Works games to come on PC for the LONGEST time. So many non-believers scoffed and laughed at the thought of porting to PC. I told them steam was ripe for it. We were right: Finally...we're just 1 step away from potentially Chrono Phantasma (Extend) & HOPEFULLY Guilty Gear Xrd!!! Omfg...if that happened....I'd be so fucking happy. I'd pay my $60 or whatever (hopefully $49) and go about my merry way practicing combos. Both would be heaven.

But anyways review for this game? I've been playing Blazblue since Calamity Trigger, the first game was announced and I played on console. For a game period, the netcode on console was pretty damn good. As a port to pc and only the 2nd Blazblue port, there've been a LOT of improvements. Many bugs are gone, the game runs buttery smooth offline at 60 fps, and of course all the modes are included too. However, there are a couple relatively small issues:

1. Not all resolutions are available.
2. Apparently turning mic off for online ranked play isnt possible yet?
3. netcode (for me) is very shotty (apparently other people say it's working wonderfully for them so good)

There's a couple other things, but I'd say they did a good job :) learned from the mistakes of the first game, so I'm REALLY hoping the next one will be almost perfect. I practically harassed and always threw in comments related to pc for ANY ArcSys media or facebook post...I'll keep doing it until we get CP & Xrd...so lets do it!!!

13416839.review:
В Blazblue играл ещё на консоли, но после того, как вынужден был продать её, очень обрадовался, узнав, что её-таки портировали. Да не просто портировали, с перенесли сразу Extend-версию!
Итак, что я могу сказать...
Если вам нравятся кнопкодробительные японские файтинги и название Guilty Gear вам что-то да говорит, эту игру стоит покупать безо всяких размышлений.
Множество интересных, калорийных и действительно разных персонажей, прекрасная сюжетная линия, на полное осознание которой могут уйти многие часы (к слову, сюжет здесь, пожалуй, наиболее сильная сторона. Все персонажи на своём месте, интересная интрига, куча загадок и теорий и множество подысторий - это вам не просто оправдание для мордобоя, а добротно прописанная вселенная со своими законами и тайнами).
Сражения стремительные, захватывающие, требующие сосредоточения и хорошей реакции. Людям, предпочитающих медленный, размеренный геймплей (а также страдающих эпилепсией XD) лучше встать и выйти - японские файтинги не прощают промедлений! Как уже говорил выше, все персонажи разительно отличаются не только суперами или приёмами - каждый из них олицетворяет определённый стиль игры, один из которых может прийтись вам по душе. Люди, игравшие в предыдущие проекты студии, понимают, о чём я говорю.
Единственный недостаток, с которым я пока столкнулся - это отсутствие людей в онлайне. Возможно, просто захожу не в то время или что-то вроде того (не знаю, установлено ли тут региональное ограничение или нет - я-то думал, сразу же нарвусь на толпу сумасшедших японцев).
Вердикт: игра определённо стоит внимания. Любите хороший сюжет - берите. Любите качественные 2D-файтинги - берите. Любите и то, и другое - даже не думайте, берите!

13416653.review:
Definitely recommend this game for any fighting game adept as well as a newbie to the series.  I say this not because it's really "easy" but because the tutorial mode introduces you to the most common concepts and mechanics that exist for every fighting game, as well as mechanics exclusive to this game itself.  

People coming from a SF background might be a little confused at first because the movement in BlazBlue is "low-gravity" and very air-centric.  Footsies are pretty useless and mix-ups are your best friend here.  People can recover in the air as well so the game is fast-paced.

The animations are extremely clean and well done; they are good on the eyes.  Most people seem to prefer to the Japanese voices but I may be in the minority that prefers the English voices.  Either way, I say both are well done even if I can't understand a lick.  

Not a fan of the music but you will be if you enjoy metal cause that's basically all there is.  

Netcode actually works but lag is lag so it's not foolproof.

Overall a very good game that unfortunately gets overlooked, probably because of it's anime style.  
A little expensive (you can buy the latest iteration for around the same price, probably less) but you'll have to work with what you got.

13399367.review:
Continuum Shift Extend, while an iteration behind the PS3 BlazBlue releases, is still a very fun fighter. The roster is filled with diverse characters (both in appearance and gameplay style), the visuals are top-notch and brought consoles to their limits, and the music (while not as good as Guilty Gear's) is memorable and appropriate for the characters/stages. 

As for the porting job, ArcSys put in more effort with this PC port than any of their other port jobs, and it shows. Using their BlazBlue Calamity Trigger port for reference:

[*] The many bugs present in BBCT (memory leaks, alt+tab graphic glitches, missing music) have been fixed
[*] As a result performance is much smoother, and most halfway-decent setups can expect an uninterrupted 60FPS at all times
[*] Arbitrary resolution support, allowing you to play in resolutions far beyond the console standard of 720p
[*] GFWL has been replaced with Steamworks-enabled netplay (which is very smooth)
[*] As a result, BBCSE also has Steam Cloud integration and achievements
[*] A decent amount of bonuses for PC buyers (bundled soundtrack, art collection, complimentary Japanese voice DLC, Steam Trading Cards)

It's not a 100% perfect port, but it's more than passable; I've been able to have an enjoyable time with BBCSE without any major hindrance at all. I'm very satisfied with this port, and I would recommend it to anyone who has been wanting to dive into BlazBlue but doesn't own a PS3/360.

13398659.review:
Well where to start...

This version is more friendly to beginners.

You are no longer dropped into game with no hint whatssoever. Hell, there is a tutorial mode this time around for those who don't know how to play 2D fighting game at all. And for those who has the basic down, there is also a 'challenge' mode to learn and practice moves and combos.

And for those who thinks 'hell' difficulty is for scrubs and seek more challenge, the 'new' (okay, let's face it. We are talking about a 3-year-old game, 5 if you count the original BBCS. So it's hardly 'new') Unlimited Mars mode will make you wish you hadn't thought of that...

And if you think Unlimited Mars mode is easy. Congratulations, there is now network play to prove that statement.

TL;DR: Easy to learn, hard to master. BBCSe Is an definite improvement over BBCT (at least on steam).

13380627.review:
Blazblue features a great sci-fi story told via visual novel sections interspersed with the best 2D fighter gameplay I've ever experienced.

Continuum Shift Extend contains a condensed version of Calamity Trigger's story complete with most of the memorable fights as well as minor beneficial tweaks, the entirety of Continuum Shift, and a few extra story routes not found elsewhere. Because of this, it makes a great entry point into the series for newcomers.

The story takes place in a post-apocalyptic world in which society has already been rebuilt and futuristic tech that runs off magic has been developed. The lore is quite complicated, but most of it is explained in the non-canon "Teach Me, Miss Litchi" segments, which consist of light-hearted skits performed by super-deformed versions of the game's main characters. Having the lore explanations separate from the main game allows for the main storylines to move at a decent pace. As for tone, there is a serious story in the game that is told in a serious manner, but there is also an abundance of humour and gag routes in the series.

The actual gameplay seems to cater to both hardcore competitive fighter fans and unskilled casual players (like me). Combos are easy to pull off and flow together well and the easy difficulty is rather easy. The game also features some more complex mechanics for the more hardcore fans and there is a ranked online mode so such individuals can really put their skills to the test.

The PC version seems to play just as well as the console versions. The 16 song soundtrack features the songs of the new characters and the opening to Continuum Shift 2. The opening to Extend, "Sōkyū no Hikari," and a special Ranga vs. µ-12 song, "Pandora Tears," are missing while an instrumental version of "Blue Bloom" titled "Spiral" is included. The music mostly focuses on a mix of orchestral metal and a bit of pop. The bonus art is all highly compressed into one PDF file and I recognize most of it from the in-game gallery.

Highly recommended to all but those who already own it on other platforms.

13379762.review:
Несмотря на то, что я отыграл в нее [strike]пока что[/strike] 5 часов, могу с уверенностью сказать, что неожиданный порт BlazBlue: Continuum Shift Extend удался на славу. Наконец-то можно играть вдвоем на одной клавиатуре, есть возможность вменяемо настроить управление. Мультиплеер на удивление стабилен, даже с моим пингом я смог нормально так отыграть несколько раундов с минимальными лагами. Несмотря на кучу гневных сообщений в форуме, за эти 5 часов игра ни разу не вылетала, не зависала, не тормозила, не шипела, не кряхтела, и не вытворяля еще чего непотребного.

Что касается самой игры, то она однозначно жжет напалмом:
[list]
    [*]Достаточно продуманная боевая система, позволяющая развернуться по полной как и новичкам, так и профессионалам. Также для новичков есть специальная схема управления Stylish Mode, позволяющая делать спецприемы и комбо по нажатию одной кнопки.
    [*]Большой набор персонажей, каждый со своим стилем борьбы.
    [*]Красивая двухмерная графика, отличная анимация спрайтов позволяет делать зрелищные комбо, каждый персонаж имеет яркий и запоминающийся дизайн, а также крайне зрелищные добивания Astral Heat.
    [*]Отличная музыка от Daisuke Ishiwatari и других, где помимо забойного метала, нашлось место так и мелодичному инструменталу.
    [*]Эпичный сюжет, завязанный на эксперементах и временных парадоксах, подающийся как визуальная новелла. Присутствует как и драма, так и комедия. В качестве приятного сюрприза имеется сценарий первой части, правда не уверен, насколько он полон (прошу подправить, если что).
    [*]Широкий набор режимов. Помимо традиционного режима аркады и спарринга, есть упомянутый выше сюжетный режим, режим испытаний, Time Attack, режим тренировки, режим обучения, а также экзотика под названием Unlimited Mars и Abyss.
    [*]Есть говорящий голосом Сакаты Гинтоки из Gintama Рагна.
    [*]Хакумен излучает эпичность в невообразимых объемах.
[/list]

Но тем не менее, без ложек дегтя не обошлось:
[list]
    [*]Игра на момент написания рекомендации не доступна для покупки в европейских регионах. Надеюсь, это исправят.
    [*]Включаемый с игрой в качестве бонусного контента OST с битрейтом 128 kbps очень плохо звучит даже на моих наушниках за 800 рублей. Господи, даже в BlazBlue: Calamity Trigger саундтрек был с православным битрейтом 320 kbps.
[/list]

Игра однозначно стоит покупки, особенно если вы хотите поиграть в BlazBlue: Chronophantasma или даже в Guilty Gear Xrd на своем компьютере, ведь Arc System Works намекали на то, что в случае хороших продаж они рассмотрят возможность выхода других своих игр на PC.

13379628.review: 继多年之前平衡性很差的第一作BBCT之后，相隔几个版本，超赞的BBCSEX也终于登陆PC了，支持网络联机对战。苍翼默示录这款游戏招式连段的流畅性，在众多FTG游戏中都是出类拔萃的，招式与招式之间的衔接不会给人突兀的感觉（招式衔接突兀僵硬这是很多2D格斗游戏的通病），豪华CV全程语音的剧情，更深入的了解"蒼"的世界！详细的教学模式方便新人上手，丰富的单机模式更是增加游戏的可玩性，病娇，傲娇，萝莉，正太，基，腐，宅，各种属性应有尽有。最后，拉姆达超可爱！

13375278.review: Fantastic PC port of the sequel to Calamity Trigger originally released on console years ago. Superb anime/visual novel graphic style, several added characters, even more outstanding OST's, and awesome continued story throughout (including great re-tell of CT events). New casual and competitive modes have been added such as Tutorial (top-notch quality), Unlimited Mars (battle tougher versions of chara's on extremely hard AI), Challenge (advanced combo practicing), and Abyss (dungeon-floor based with shop/upgrade system) to go with the classic modes from the first game. 13356212.review:
앞서 스팀에 올라온 전작, CT(캐러미티 트리거)에 비해 훨씬 발전했다. 
튜토리얼 추가, 콤보 학습 콘텐츠 추가, 전작까지 포함하여 스토리 추가, 기타 자잘한 콘텐츠 추가. 네트워크 대전 추가. 솔직히 이쯤되면 전작을 살 이유가 사라지는 셈. 
비기너 모드라고 해서 초보자들이 버튼만 누르면 콤보가 나가게 해놓은 모드가 있는데... 그건 하지 말자. 섬세한 조작이 중요한 게임이기에, 비기너 모드로는 컴퓨터도 못 깬다. 콤보도 초급 수준이고, 그나마 몇 캐릭터는 단순한 버튼 연타로는 콤보도 못 쓰는 모드. 차라리 전작의 단축키가 훨씬 좋았다. 

게임 그 자체만 놓고 보면 전작처럼 여전히 하드하다. 파고들 요소가 많다. 다르게 말하면 콤보 하나 연습한다고 6시간 넘게 인생을 낭비하기 쉽다. 그만큼 연습해놓고 실전에서 써먹으면 나름 재미있긴 하지만... 원래 그런 맛에 격겜하는거 아닐까 생각한다. 근데 개인적으론 길티기어가 더 재밌다.(길티기어 지역제한 풀어달라고!!!)

다만 스팀 격투게임의 고질적인 문제, "네트워크 대전=그들만의 리그"는 어쩔 수 없는 문제다. 오히려 킹오파나 스파4의 경우는 상대방의 기술이 뭔지 보이기라도 하지, 이 게임은 상대방이 뭘 하는지도 모르고 당할 때가 많으니 멘탈에 금이 가기 쉽다. 유저가 많으면야 고수에서 초보까지 골고루 분포가 되겠다만... 워낙 매니악한 게임에 난이도도 높은 편이라, 유저는 극소수의 고수만 하는 게임. 초보따윈 없다. 

그러니까 게이머는 네트워크 대전을 멀리하고, 컴까기를 가까이 하는게 낫습니다.

13344369.review:
BlazBlue(蒼翼末示錄)雖然算上手難度很高的FTG，不過這一代有收錄"帥氣模式"，簡化按鍵成"輕攻擊"、"重攻擊"、"必殺技"、"投擲技"，只要連打輕攻擊角色就會打出華麗的連段，格鬥苦手的玩家可以利用這模式上手

本作還有收錄"故事模式"，玩起來就像以對話為主的AVG，讓格鬥遊戲的劇情不再那麼死板無腦，故事模式的戰鬥難度也不高，搭配上剛剛提到的"帥氣模式"就算格鬥新手也能享受劇情

小缺點是沒有完整支援各種解析度，預設的1280X768是最不會破壞畫質的解析度，但是會超出邊框一點，調整成1280X720或1920X1080的話比例會被破壞造成有點2D破圖的現象，全營幕時2D點陣顆粒會變得很明顯反而破壞畫質


這款是蒼翼末示錄的第二部作品，第三部作品已經出了，照這模式看來也可以期待會在STEAM上推出
這家公司還有製作過Guilty Gear(聖騎士之戰)，風格一樣是日本動漫風，系統也跟BlazBlue很類似屬於高速連擊類型的FTG，其最新作GG Xrd也希望能在STEAM上推出呀-3-

13332160.review:
This is a very good port of the 7th-Generation console versions. A seamless port if you will.
New players should expect this to be a fast-paced 2D JFighter, so expect to chain combos after combos. This is not your typical Street Fighter (although it has the same fundmentals as all Fighters [Training, Challenges, Story, Arcade, Versus, Online Multiplayer]). 
Familiar fans should expect this to play very very similarly to Guilty Gear. 
Returning fans should expect no change.

It was worth the full price on the 7th-Gen consoles when it came out and it is worth the -10% (or 20% for those that have Calamity Trigger), as well as the full $30 for this seamless port.

Now all that is left is for us to wait for BlazBlue: Chrono Phantasma

13329572.review:
With over 6k Makoto online matches and over 500h logged on the ps3 version of BBCSEX alone, I can honestly say this is by far my favorite installment of the BlazBlue series... Determined by me and many of my friends to currently be the most balanced (this is before the NA release of BBCP2). That being said I feel the NA price point of this steam release is a bit steep. The game probably should've been priced at 15USD and included the soundtrack with the jp voices. As for the online, I don't like that they removed the connection conditions to rooms that existed in the ps3 version. Because every now and then someone with a low connection to me will join and bog down the entire experience. Another thing is you can't leave rooms while a match is started even when you're a spectator... I'm currently running this game at 1080p 61 fps [full] windows 7 64bit with well over the required specs and it has only crashed once so stability doesn't seem to be a problem. For my last minor annoyance when configuring your buttons you have to press R1 to switch to the device that you want to configure at first I had no idea and it doesn't seem very obvious either. BlazBlue remains to this day the only fighting game I enjoy and literally can't put down. If you like stunning 2D sprites, an unrivaled fighting game story, fluid 2D animations, plus a fighting experience that is unlike any other. I'd recommend this game to you.

Thanks.

블레이블루 팬이라면 현가에 지를 가치가 있다고 생각합니다.

가끔 키설정이 안 된다고 하시는 분들이 계신데요.

방법을 알려드리겠습니다. ASDFZXCV가 현재 2P에게 배정되어 있는 상태이기 때문에 덮어씌우기가 안 되는 것일 겁니다. ^^

13323395.review:
Well, here it is. The second chapter in the Blaz Blue series.

Pros'

+ Decent net code.
+ Enjoyable story mode, with endearing characters, and well written dialogue.
+ Fairly balanced, even the low tier characters can be viable if you understand the gameplay mechanics.
+ Abyss and Unlimited Mars modes are both fun for casual and hardcore play, if you're looking for some single player action outside of Arcade and Story mode.
+ Lots of content.

Cons.

- Price tag.  I can see why people who already own this game wouldn't pick it up for $25 - $30.
- Unlimited Mu-12 is a cheap bitch.
- Watered down acheivements. Seriously, where's all the character specific acheivements at?

If you haven't played this game yet and enjoy a good fighting game, a dungeon crawling experience masked in a fighting game, or some good old fashioned visual novel storytelling, than do yourself a favor and pick this up.

Another great feature of the game it has a very indepth tutorial for new players. Also, it worked right away with my MadCatz Arcade Stick.

13322822.review:
Despite all of the complaints about this being an older game (indeed, its sequel has already seen a release on PS3 and Vita, albeit in an incomplete state), this port is brand-new. It includes all of the display options from the earlier Calamity Trigger port (which I was hoping for, in all honesty) and the gameplay itself feels as smooth as it did on the PS3. Netplay is also on-par with the console versions, which has led to some confusion due to the intense lag during the fight intro, which gives way to smoother connections during the fight itself. All-in-all, a good package. 

My only real complaint about the game would have to be its price: maybe Arc System Works or H2 Interactive could've offered a cheaper "standard version" of the game, that would've removed the digital art book and soundtrack and dropped the price by $10 or so, but it's a little late for that. I'd recommend any die-hard fans of the series who want ASW to port more games to PC to pick this up ASAP (the 10% early discount [20% if you own BBCT] definitely softens the blow). Everyone else may want to wait for a sale before picking this one up.

13322290.review:
To me, price is the only con.

I've been playing BlazBlue for quite a while on consoles. I'm also super biased when it comes to "anime fighters". So here's my honest opinion: This is game is too fast and too deep. Everything in this game happens at faster pace than that of Street Fighter, if this is your first anime fighter, dive in with a friend, or into network mode. This game favors unrelentless fast offense, crazy combo mashing and occasional smart defense. If this sounds like something you might like, then get over here. But don't expect to be reading your opponents until you're sufficiently capable.

Playing with a controller is the best idea here, or an arcade stick if you prefer. It's very hard to play competitively on a keyboard. 

There is a lot to learn in this fighting game and, while the tutorial mode is very extensive, it is -unfortunately- super boring. After playing through it completely, I had forgotten mostly everything. Playing with someone else made me appreciate the intricacies of this game. Just pick Stylish mode Ragna (this game's "basic" character), go to Network mode, and mash some buttons. Eventually you'll get used to the pace. 

Then you can dive into the Challenges section. Which will provide you with ways to inflict damage. If you need more, there is YouTube. And after that, you can head over to Dustloop.com where anime weebs like me can teach you even more.

There is much to be said, but nobody will probably read it. Characters are very cute. Some music is very good. Story is a big time traveling joke to me that would fit in any anime perfectly (points for that). PC graphical options are just barely OK. Nice improvement from CT. There's good online (finally). Game is not the latest version though. Too expensive when the sequel is going for around the same.

In conclusion: Just buy this so the creators can bring Guilty Gear Xrd to PC. Which is what everybody really wants. Oh and this game's sequel too.

PS. Play this in 720p or it's gonna look pixelated.

Полный набор ДЛЦ. Ничего не надо докупать, всё сразу здесь, пользуйтесь. Прямо как на PS3. Удобно, приятно, радует.

13320412.review:
No my friends, your eyes do not deceive you. For once, this is NOT a lazy rerelease of an already existing, outdated PC-port. This is an all new PC release of Blazblue: Continuum Shift Extend that includes solid netplay that is eons above what we got with the GFWL-enabled Calamity Trigger all those years back. 

The graphics costumization is average and about what you'd expect for a 2D game these days with only resolutions and anti-aliasing options being present. 
Unfortunately, while this port is new, the game itself isn't,
there is already a newer version called Chrono Phantasma out on consoles.
Still, it's certainly a start and a huge improvement over the other Arc System Works fighters we have got on steam at the moment.

13319821.review:
DOUBLE 10/10! TRIPLE 10/10! Game of eternity!

Basically, it's an interesting and exciting fighting game, complete with AMAZING story, art, and music.
You can either get competitive and serious about it, perfect your "skillz", "git gud" and go punch someone online or get nine-digit scores in every mode...
Or you can focus on enjoying everything there is to the story, with its variety of fun characters, mind bending plot lines and unique contrast of epicness and humour...
Actually, do both. It's good for both, don't miss out on anything.

It's actually a sequel to "Calamity Trigger", but... that one had some issues on PC.
And this has a recap of CT's campaing anyway, so just go through that.

13316594.review:
Almost there. Online mode too! 

This game actually has around 7 new characters total, the description compares it to Continuum Shift vanilla, which wasn't released on PC.

A great fighting game with great flashy mechanics and great music. Even if you're new to the series or fighting games, Continuum Shift adds a good Tutorial mode, explaining the basics and advanced stuff, and even some character specific stuff. 

For features, the Story Mode includes a retelling of Calamity Triggers' (the first BlazBlue) story, and the new stuff is told in the style of a visual novel with some fights in between and some choices too (some story paths lead to joke or alternate endings.) There's a Challenge mode which challenges you to perform combos, Abyss mode which is basically a long survival run where you can purchase items beforehand with points that are also used to buy unlocks in the Gallery, and the other single player arcade mode and Calamity Trigger stuff. The gallery still has sound test, the last time it appears in BlazBlue as of BBCP 1.1. This version is also more combo focused and sports a few mechanic tweaks that make it different to the other games in the series like the Guard Primer system only allowing a certain number of blocks from specific moves before a Guard Crush occurs.

The game appears to be the latest console version (seems like the part about Legion mode was removed from the product description and I don't see it unlocked or in the Gallery unlocks.) with fast load times.

Running on Windows 8.1, performance is good (60fps cap, 1080p available) but I can't say whether this game suffers from the issue Calamity Trigger does regarding PC uptime (I recently restarted my PC and Calamity Trigger ran fine before I tested Continuum Shift).

Update: PC uptime as of this update is at 3 days, 8 hours, 30minutes~ Calamity Trigger performance shot down to 30 sometime within the last 12 hours that I last ran it, Continuum Shift performance is still hitting 60. This is on an i7 4790k with 16GB of RAM and a GTX 970. Good port job on this title, compared to Calamity Trigger and how the Arcade leak ran.

13315928.review:
BlazBlue é a série de Fighting Games mais recente da Arc System, após deixarem disponível o BlazBlue Calamity Trigger na Steam (sem online por retirarem o sistema "Games for Windows Live" dele), a empresa coreana H2 converte a ante-penultima atualização mais recente da série, Continuum Shift Extend. Ignorando o fato de que não foi posto a versão mais atual do game (ChronoPhantasma, apesar que já foi anunciado a versão Extend), o port vale a pena?

O port é basicamente a versão XBox 360 de CSE, com todos os modos da versão dele disponiveis (exceto a de compra de DLC), com uma observação que H2 copiou o "release notes" da Aksys, que erroneamente citava a presença do "Legion Mode", ainda exclusividade do Continuum Shift de console original. Portanto o que está presente é o modo Abyss, nada muito grave além de que já foi corrigido a descrição.

Esta versão conta com todos os personagens vindos de Calamity Trigger (notando que V-No.13 virou a versão "boss" de Λ-No.11, esta sua versão "jogável" desde CS), Continuum Shift e seus DLCs (ou do CSII caso tenha jogado nos portáteis), a adição desta versão é o personagem Relius Clover (dublado por Junichi Suwabe/Travis Willingham), pai de Carl Clover, sua jogabilidade é parecida com os dos personagens do jogo Jojo Bizarre Adventure: Heritage for Future da Capcom. Os únicos DLCs da Extend são vozes de sistema que já estão inclusos na versão Steam sem custo adicional (exemplo como Asami Mai, dubladora de Tsubaki). Há um misterioso anuncio que "o DLC de voz japonesa está incluso no lançamento de graça", houve relatos de compradores que não conseguiram ativar a voz japonesa, porém comprei e não tive problemas, e após o lançamento parece que há ninguém mais com este problema.

O DLC de voz se encontra no link abaixo
store.steampowered.com/app/333460/
Agora se após o lançamento ele vai ser pago...

O modo história foi expandido, agora conta com um ótimo resumo do primeiro game, Calamity Trigger, além de rotas para os personagens adicionados por DLC que não tinham modo história sendo eles Tsubaki, Valkenhayn, Platinum e Relius. Também conta com a "ex-exclusividade" dos portáteis de duas histórias extras.

Não testei muitos controles mas os que usam "Direct Input" funcionam sem problema, as direções não são invertidas. O unico porém é que o botão Start e Select são "trocados", e a configuração padrão fica desorganizada por tudo (mas pode ser reconfigurada normalmente). Falando em configurar, pro teclado é prático e fácil, porém para os controles é bizarro pois com o configurado pro 1P/2P no teclado você precisa ir até os botões que quer configurar nos controles 1P/2P (usando Control/Alt) e aí sim você pode configurar. Um pequeno inconveniente. As configurações de resolução são satisfatórias, contando com opção FULL para uma "pequena esticada" nas laterais ou ARCADE que mantém a pixel art do game.

Netcode continua com as ótimas features da versão console, como lobbies, modo expectador, nomear salas, frases pré-prontas, entre outros. Porém jogando com pessoas aleatórioas não tive uma boa experiência, no geral a experiência foi muito positiva, principalmente com jogadores da minha região (Brasil). O procedimento de na primeira partida contra uma pessoa não apressar a "introdução" do cenário e personagens parece deixar mais "suave" a estabilidade do netplay.

Vale a pena? Se você realmente esperava um game da Arc System com bastante conteudo e sem nenhum DLC, vá em frente, agora caso veja problema com o preço ou é apenas curioso com a franquia eu recomendo infelizmente esperar uma promoção, no geral achei o preço abusivo (mesmo com os 20% de desconto, 10% do lançamento e 10% por ter o BBCT, totalizando R$ 44,79 reais nesta data do review), espero que mesmo assim o port renda com os fãs de maior renda/loucura e possamos ter o BBCP 2.0/Extend portado em pouco tempo depois dos consoles.
